BinTree

Description

Module name: BinTree | Description: our own Haskell implementation of a Binary Search Tree, uses features of Internal.

insert :: Ord a => a -> BinTree a -> BinTree a Source #

Inserts single value into a BinTree.

height :: (Num b, Ord b) => BinTree a -> b Source #

Returns height of the tree.

list2BST :: (Eq a, Ord a) => [a] -> BinTree a Source #

Builds a BinTree on the basis of a list.

sumBinTree :: Num a => BinTree a -> a Source #

Sums all values in a BinTree.

mapBinTree :: (a -> b) -> BinTree a -> BinTree b Source #

Performs BinTree mapping, for example: mapBinTree (^2) BTNode 7 (BTNode 6 EmptyBT EmptyBT) (BTNode 8 EmptyBT (BTNode 9 EmptyBT (BTNode 10 EmptyBT EmptyBT))) => BTNode 49 (BTNode 36 EmptyBT EmptyBT) (BTNode 64 EmptyBT (BTNode 81 EmptyBT (BTNode 100 EmptyBT EmptyBT)))
